page.title: 10POTATOES DOWNDERRY
page.content: A MILD,USUALLY FROST FREE,CLIMATE OVER EASILY WORKED FLAT CLIFFTOP LAND NEAR THE SEA WHICH PROVIDED SAND AND SEAWEED FOR SOIL FERTILITY LED DOWNDERRY TO BECOME NATIONALLY FAMOUS FOR ITS EARLY POTATOES WHICH VIA PLYMOUTH COULD REACH BRITISH MARKETS RAPIDLY.GROWERS TOOK A PRIDE IN QUALITY OF THEIR OUTPUT AND MEN WERE KNOWN TO DIG AND BAG UP TO 36cwt.IN ONE DAY.MODERN TRANSPORT ALLOWED SCILLY AND FOREIGN PRODUCE TO SUPPLANT THE CROPS NURTURED ON SMALL CLIFFSIDE PLOTS.ADJACENT FARMERS HAVE ACCEPTED THE CHALLENGE SO WITH MODERN NUTRIENTS ,NEW VARIETIES AND MECHANICAL HARVESTING THEY ARE AGAIN LEADING THE FIELD.STORM STRANDED SEAWEED IS STILL OFTEN AVAILABLE BUT IS RARELY USED EXCEPT BY HOBBY GARDENERS.A NOTED EXCEPTION IS THE COMMUNE AT KEVERAL WHICH AVOIDS CHEMICAL PRODUCTS .
